noise Package¶

noise_model Module¶

exception sigvisa.models.noise.noise_model.NoNoiseException[source]¶

Bases: exceptions.Exception

sigvisa.models.noise.noise_model.arrivals_intersect_block(block_start, block_end, arrival_times, danger_period_seconds=400)[source]¶
sigvisa.models.noise.noise_model.block_waveform_exists(sta, chan, stime, etime)[source]¶
sigvisa.models.noise.noise_model.classicSTALTAPy(a, nsta, nlta)[source]¶

Computes the standard STA/LTA from a given input array a. The length of the STA is given by nsta in samples, respectively is the length of the LTA given by nlta in samples. Written in Python.

There exists a faster version of this trigger wrapped in C called classicSTALTA() in this module!

Parameters:
  • a (NumPy ndarray) – Seismic Trace
  • nsta (Int) – Length of short time average window in samples
  • nlta (Int) – Length of long time average window in samples
Return type:

NumPy ndarray
Returns:

Characteristic function of classic STA/LTA
sigvisa.models.noise.noise_model.construct_and_save_hourly_noise_models(hour, sta, chan, filter_str, srate, order, block_len_seconds=300)[source]¶
sigvisa.models.noise.noise_model.construct_and_save_immediate_noise_models(time, sta, chan, filter_str, srate, order)[source]¶
sigvisa.models.noise.noise_model.construct_and_save_noise_models(minute, block_len_seconds, sta, chan, filter_str, srate, order, model_wave=None)[source]¶
sigvisa.models.noise.noise_model.get_median_noise_wave(sta, chan, hour_start, hour_end, block_len_seconds)[source]¶
sigvisa.models.noise.noise_model.get_noise_model(waveform=None, sta=None, chan=None, filter_str=None, time=None, srate=40, order=17, noise_mode=1)[source]¶

Returns an ARModel noise model of the specified order for the given station/channel/filter, trained from the hour prior to the given time. Results are cached, so each noise model is learned only once.

This method takes either a station, channel, filter string, and time, or a Waveform object from which these can all be read.

sigvisa.models.noise.noise_model.get_recent_safe_block(time, sta, chan, margin_seconds=10, preferred_len_seconds=120, min_len_seconds=60, arrival_window_seconds=1200)[source]¶

Get a block of time preceding the specified time, and ending at least margin_seconds before that time, for which waveform data exists, and during which there are no recorded arrivals at the station.
